data.scheme_name: West Bengal New and Renewable Energy Manufacturing Promotion Policy 2023 - Existing
data.benefits: The Scheme provides 100% exemption on land mutation and conversion fees, Stamp duty, water cess, electricity duty, skill development subsidy.
data.eligibility:
Units engaged in the manufacturing of renewable energy equipment.
The manufacturing units must be located within the state of West Bengal
data.conditions:
Submit a Letter of Intent to the Director of Industries, West Bengal.
Receive a certificate of registration from the Director of Industries, West Bengal. 
Obtain an endorsement letter from the NRES Department certifying eligibility.
data.beneficiaries:
Units engaged in the manufacturing of renewable energy equipment.

data.context: This policy aims to boost local manufacturing of renewable energy components to meet rising energy demands and support India’s clean energy targets. It incentivizes investments in renewable energy production to reduce costs and enhance the state’s energy security and sustainability.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to incentivize and attract investments in renewable energy manufacturing units within the state. This aims to address supply-side gaps, reduce renewable power generation costs, and establish an ecosystem for vendors and ancillary producers, thereby enhancing the state's clean energy capacity and contributing to energy security and climate risk management.
data.description:
The following exemptions to the extent of 100% are applicable to all eligible units: 

a. Land Mutation & Conversion Fees for privately purchased lands to set up the Units within the Policy Period 

b. Stamp Duty and registration fees: For all transactions of land deeds entered into for setting up of New and Renewable Energy equipment manufacturing units within the Policy Period 

c. Water Cess: Any additional Charge by way of Cess or duty or levy by any State Agency for supplying water to the Unit. 

d. Electricity Duty: For all Units going for expansion or establishment of New Units having registered within the Policy Period and have commenced operations within two years from the Policy End Date. The electricity duty exemption shall be valid for a period of five (5) years from date of commencement of commercial operations. 

e. Skill Development Subsidy: The industrial units would be allowed to gain the benefit of skill development initiatives as proclaimed under the "Utkarsh Bangla" industry-led module. Rates payable shall be as per the then prevailing notified rates. Where necessary, State Government in TET&SD Department would assist the skilling endeavor involving ITIS and polytechnics under its control.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply online via the WBIDC or 'Silpa Sathi' portal, or offline by submitting forms and documents to the WBIDC office, with all clearances processed through the 'Silpa Sathi' single window clearance system.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
